resources.string: The Main Brain. Does things like finding "X" from "X=42^(1-4+9)
An accelerrated processing unit, glueing the graphics chip onto the cpu.
What if you could do two things at once, on one core?
The main controlling unit of the CPU.
Cheat out consumers by faking them cores. Wooo!
To prevent your CPU from replacing your grill
Probably gives the most heat dissapation
Most definitely gives the most heat dissapation.
Help to transfer heat from CPU to the cooler
The Other Main Brain. Does things like comparing two numbers
Can be used to improve logic
Hugely speeds up the fetching time from registers.
Caches hugely reduce the time needed to access memory.
Even faster than 1st Level cache, but laggier.
Integrates the 3rd level cache directly onto the chip, reducing the access time dramatically,
Use less power! Save the planet!
One giant leap in... making things smaller? Using smaller and smaller components has net a considerable power and efficiency increase.
Yes, it really did take you four years to figure out how to save even ten percent more power on the chips themselves, you didn't want to sacrifice performance.
A crazy scientist named "Bob" in the depths of your Research and Development dept. thinks he's solved the universe itself... or at least 7% more power savings.
